html:
Turn on the Haptic keyboard

Apple has finally added a Haptic keyboard to the iPhone! But what is this?

Basically, a haptic keyboard is where your phone makes a little vibration whenever you type a character or press on the screen to scroll or tap a button.

It helps make your phone a little more tactile and many people really like this, saying that it helps them to make fewer mistakes when typing messages or emails.

Apple has added this feature in the new iOS 16 but it isnâ€™t set up as a default setting.

To start using it, go to your Settings app and select the Sound and Haptics section.

Turn on the Haptic keyboard

From here, go to Keyboard Feedback and then you can enable sounds and haptics.
